qas.question: What was once named the "ugliest street in America" by Life magazine?
What mayor was quoted in calling Speedway Boulevard "the ugliest street in America?
Which newspaper did David Leighton work for?
What city is the Harlem River Speedway in?
What sports field is in Reid Park?
What zoo is in Reid Park?
What was the "ugliest street in America" in the 1970s?
What was Speedway Blvd called in the 1990s?

context: Tucson's largest park, <a0_0><a5_0>Reid Park<a5_0/><a0_0/>, is located in midtown and includes <a7_0>Reid Park Zoo<a7_0/> and <a6_0>Hi Corbett Field<a6_0/>. <a1_0><a8_0>Speedway Boulevard<a8_0/><a1_0/>, a major east-west arterial road in central Tucson, was named the "ugliest street in America" by Life magazine in the early 1970s, quoting Tucson Mayor <a2_0>James Corbett<a2_0/>. Despite this, Speedway Boulevard was awarded <a9_0>"Street of the Year"<a9_0/> by Arizona Highways in the late 1990s. According to David Leighton, historical writer for the <a3_0>Arizona Daily Star<a3_0/> newspaper, Speedway Boulevard derives its name from an old horse racetrack, known as "The Harlem River Speedway," more commonly called "The Speedway," in <a4_0>New York City<a4_0/>. The street was called "The Speedway," from 1904 to about 1906 before the word "The" was taken out.
